primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of ordinary, flawed people into witnesses of truth through the inspiration of martyrs and the reception of the Spirit's power.

tekstueel_bewijs: Wir brauchen uns nicht zu fürchten
Wir können uns an andere erinnern

zender.identificatie: The Martyrs/The Poor (as mediators of God's call)
tekstueel_bewijs: Er [Romero] organisiert uns, will sagen, er bekehrt uns
von den Armen evangelisiert worden ist
in Jerusalem und ganz Judäa... und warum dann nicht auch in Hamburg-Altona

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (as Mut/Wahrheitsfähigkeit) and the Example of Romero
tekstueel_bewijs: Die Kraft des heiligen Geistes empfangen
Was sie zu töten vergaßen, machte weiter

tegenstander.identificatie: Fear, the 'stupid opinion' of saints' perfection, and political oppressors
tekstueel_bewijs: eine dumme Meinung, als seien die Heiligen ganz und gar anders als wir
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The sermon focuses more on overcoming the internal barrier of feeling 'unworthy' or 'incapable' than on the cosmic power of sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's ongoing action through the dead (Romero/Jesus) to organize and convert the living.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Dead (Romero/Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (God acting through martyrs) provides the 'competence' for the primary program (the hearer acting).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit/Romero's Example → The Hearer ← Fear/Elitism

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gottes Gebot sagt: Du sollst nicht töten
Christus sagt: Ihr werdet meine Zeugen sein
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir können uns an andere erinnern

voorbeelden: Gottes Gebot sagt: Du sollst nicht töten
Er zieht uns in den großen Bekehrungsprozess hinein
Wir brauchen nicht zu glauben, nur die Experten wüssten Bescheid
Ihr werdet die Kraft des heiligen Geistes empfangen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on empowering the hearer (Pouvoir) by removing the psychological barrier that they are 'not like the saints'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death) to ~S2 (The dead are not dead) to S1 (We become witnesses).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'Spirit' defined as human courage and the ability to speak truth.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; death is seen as a transition to a more 'active' influence rather than a final enemy.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of 'Spirit' and 'Christ', the engine is 'Exemplarism'. God is the Helper who provides 'Mut' (courage) so that the human Subject can perform the work of justice.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Wie Oscar Romero, so auch wir. Wie Jesus, so auch wir.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Ihr werdet die Kraft des heiligen Geistes empfangen

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Romero is presented as a flawed but imitable model. The hearer is encouraged to see themselves as capable of the same witness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who speaks truth through the mouths of the weak, regardless of their 'Mut'.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is collapsed into social activism.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent in its call to action but lacks a clear soteriological foundation for why the 'Spirit' is necessary beyond psychological motivation.
spanning_punten: The Spirit is promised by Christ, but defined as human 'Mut'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Wie er selber bekehrt worden ist... bekehrt sein Tod auch uns.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides 'competence' (courage) for the human task.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'not wanting to see reality' or 'murdereous intent' of others.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment narrative for social justice, using martyrs as the 'Sender' and the hearer as the 'Subject'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'be a witness'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ is the Witness who speaks through us.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Not 'We will be witnesses', but 'Christ will make His truth known through our weakness'.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the hearer as the one who is first 'evangelized' and 'saved' before they act.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: DEVOIR (God's command) met by God's POUVOIR (Grace).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that we *cannot* be witnesses on our own.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a power that silences the truth.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'Spirit' a necessity rather than a supplement.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God's victory over death (Soteriology) -> 2. Our participation (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and politically engaged, but structurally risks turning the Gospel into a 'to-do' list for the courageous.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it's an 'appeal'; semiotically, it's a 'Subject-transfer'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the 'Spirit' in Acts; Greimas shows the Spirit is reduced to a human modal competence (courage).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Jesus' and 'Romero' function as identical actants (Exemplars) rather than Savior and Saved.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Liberation Theology's actantial structure where 'The Poor' take the role of the 'Sender' of values.
